href=\"/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/5.Policy%20Index/all.md\"\u003eOver 1000 built-in policies\u003c/a\u003e cover security and compliance best practices for AWS, Azure and Google Cloud.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eScans Terraform, Terraform Plan, Terraform JSON, CloudFormation, AWS SAM, Kubernetes, Helm, Kustomize, Dockerfile, Serverless framework, Ansible, Bicep and ARM template files.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eScans Argo Workflows, Azure Pipelines, BitBucket Pipelines, Circle CI Pipelines, GitHub Actions and GitLab CI workflow files\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupports Context-awareness policies based on in-memory graph-based scanning.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupports Python format for attribute policies and YAML format for both attribute and composite policies.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDetects \u003ca href=\"/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/2.Basics/Scanning%20Credentials%20and%20Secrets.md\"\u003eAWS credentials\u003c/a\u003e in EC2 Userdata, Lambda environment variables and Terraform providers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.prismacloud.io/prisma/cloud/secrets-security\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eIdentifies secrets\u003c/a\u003e using regular expressions, keywords, and entropy based detection.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEvaluates \u003ca href=\"https://registry.terraform.io/browse/providers\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eTerraform Provider\u003c/a\u003e settings to regulate the creation, management, and updates of IaaS, PaaS or SaaS managed through Terraform.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePolicies support evaluation of \u003ca href=\"/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/2.Basics/Handling%20Variables.md\"\u003evariables\u003c/a\u003e to their optional default value.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupports in-line \u003ca href=\"/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/2.Basics/Suppressing%20and%20Skipping%20Policies.md\"\u003esuppression\u003c/a\u003e of accepted risks or false-positives to reduce recurring scan failures. Also supports global skip from using CLI.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/2.Basics/Reviewing%20Scan%20Results.md\"\u003eOutput\u003c/a\u003e currently available as CLI, \u003ca href=\"https://cyclonedx.org\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eCycloneDX\u003c/a\u003e, JSON, JUnit XML, CSV, SARIF and github markdown and link to remediation \u003ca href=\"https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/enterprise-edition/policy-reference/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eguides\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" --directory /tf\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNote: if you are using Python 3.6(Default version in Ubuntu 18.04) checkov will not work, and it will fail with \u003ccode\u003eModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'dataclasses'\u003c/code\u003e  error message. In this case, you can use the docker version instead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNote that there are certain cases where redirecting \u003ccode\u003edocker run --tty\u003c/code\u003e output to a file - for example, if you want to save the Checkov JUnit output to a file - will cause extra control characters to be printed. This can break file parsing. If you encounter this, remove the \u003ccode\u003e--tty\u003c/code\u003e flag.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003e--workdir /tf\u003c/code\u003e flag is optional to change the working directory to the mounted volume. If you are using the SARIF output \u003ccode\u003e-o sarif\u003c/code\u003e this will output the results.sarif file to the mounted volume (\u003ccode\u003e/user/tf\u003c/code\u003e in the example above). If you do not include that flag, the working directory will be \"/\".\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eRunning or skipping checks\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-running-or-skipping-checks\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Running or skipping checks\" href=\"#running-or-skipping-checks\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBy using command line flags, you can specify to run only named checks (allow list) or run all checks except\nthose listed (deny list). to skip json file secret scan.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSee the docs for more detailed information about how these flags work together.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG\ncheckov -d \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRun secrets scanning on all files in MyDirectory. Skip CKV_SECRET_6 check on json files that their suffix is DontScan\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"checkov -d /MyDirectory --framework secrets --bc-api-key ... --skip-check CKV_SECRET_6:.*DontScan.json$\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003echeckov -d /MyDirectory --framework secrets --bc-api-key ... --skip-check CKV_SECRET_6:.\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003e*\u003c/span\u003eDontScan.json$\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRun secrets scanning on all files in MyDirectory. Skip CKV_SECRET_6 check on json files that contains \"skip_test\" in path\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" --framework secrets --bc-api-key ... --skip-check CKV_SECRET_6:.\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003e*\u003c/span\u003eskip_test.\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003e*\u003c/span\u003ejson$\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eOne can mask values from scanning results by supplying a configuration file (using --config-file flag) with mask entry.\nThe masking can apply on resource \u0026amp; value (or multiple values, seperated with a comma).\nExamples:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"mask:\n- aws_instance:user_data\n- azurerm_key_vault_secret:admin_password,user_passwords\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn the example above, the following values will be masked:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003euser_data for aws_instance resource\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eboth admin_password \u0026amp;user_passwords for resource identified by \u003ccode\u003efoo-bucket\u003c/code\u003e, where the scan checks if an AWS S3 bucket is private.\nIn the example, the bucket is configured with public read access; Adding the data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"resource \u0026quot;aws_s3_bucket\u0026quot; \u0026quot;foo-bucket\u0026quot; {\n  region        = var.region\n    #checkov:skip=CKV_AWS_20:The bucket is a public static content host\n  bucket        = local.bucket_name\n  force_destroy = true\n  acl           = \u0026quot;public-read\u0026quot;\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre lang=\"hcl-terraform\" class=\"notranslate\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eresource \"aws_s3_bucket\" \"foo-bucket\" {\n  region        = var.region\n    #checkov:skip=CKV_AWS_20:The bucket is a public static content host\n  bucket        = local.bucket_name\n  force_destroy = true\n  acl           = \"public-read\"\n}\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe output would now contain a \u003ccode\u003eSKIPPED\u003c/code\u003e check result entry:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003eS3 Bucket has an ACL defined which allows public access.\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\tSKIPPED \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003efor\u003c/span\u003e resource: aws_s3_bucket.foo-bucket\n\tSuppress comment: The bucket is a public static content host\n\tFile: dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo skip files or directories, use the argument \u003ccode\u003e--skip-path\u003c/code\u003e, which can be specified multiple times. This argument accepts regular expressions for paths relative to the current working directory. You can use it to skip entire directories and / or specific files.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBy default, all directories named \u003ccode\u003enode_modules\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e.terraform\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003e.serverless\u003c/code\u003e will be skipped, in addition to any files or directories beginning with \u003ccode\u003e.\u003c/code\u003e.\nTo cancel skipping directories beginning with \u003ccode\u003e.\u003c/code\u003e override \u003ccode\u003eCKV_IGNORE_HIDDEN_DIRECTORIES\u003c/code\u003e environment variable \u003ccode\u003eexport CKV_IGNORE_HIDDEN_DIRECTORIES=false\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can override the default set of directories to skip by setting the environment variable \u003ccode\u003eCKV_IGNORED_DIRECTORIES\u003c/code\u003e.\nNote that if you want to preserve this list and add to it, you must include these values. For example, \u003ccode\u003eCKV_IGNORED_DIRECTORIES=mynewdir\u003c/code\u003e will skip only that directory, but not the others mentioned above. This variable is legacy functionality; we recommend using the \u003ccode\u003e--skip-file\u003c/code\u003e flag.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 By default, checkov looks for a \u003ccode\u003e.checkov.yaml\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003e.checkov.yml\u003c/code\u003e file in the following places in order of precedence:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDirectory against which checkov is run. (\u003ccode\u003e--directory\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCurrent working directory where checkov is called.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUser's home directory.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAttention\u003c/strong\u003e: it is a best practice for checkov configuration file to be loaded from a trusted source composed by a verified identity, so that scanned files, check ids and loaded custom checks are as desired.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsers can also pass in the path to a config file via the command line. In this case, the other config files will be ignored. For example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"checkov --config-file path/to/config.yaml\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003echeckov --config-file path/to/config.yaml\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUsers can also create a config file using the \u003ccode\u003e--create-config\u003c/code\u003e command, which takes the current command line args and writes them out to a given path. For example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"checkov --compact --directory test-dir --docker-image sample-image --dockerfile-path Dockerfile --download-external-modules True --external-checks-dir sample-dir --quiet --repo-id prisma-cloud/sample-repo --skip-check CKV_DOCKER_3,CKV_DOCKER_2 --skip-framework dockerfile secrets --soft-fail --branch develop --check CKV_DOCKER_1 --create-config /Users/sample/config.yml\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003echeckov --compact --directory test-dir --docker-image sample-image --dockerfile-path Dockerfile --download-external-modules True --external-checks-dir sample-dir --quiet --repo-id prisma-cloud/sample-repo --skip-check CKV_DOCKER_3,CKV_DOCKER_2 --skip-framework dockerfile secrets --soft-fail --branch develop --check CKV_DOCKER_1 --create-config /Users/sample/config.yml\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWill create a \u003ccode\u003econfig.yaml\u003c/code\u003e file which looks like this:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-yaml notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"branch: develop\ncheck:\n  - CKV_DOCKER_1\ncompact: true\ndirectory:\n  - test-dir\ndocker-image: sample-image\ndockerfile-path: Dockerfile\ndownload-external-modules: true\nevaluate-variables: true\nexternal-checks-dir:\n  - sample-dir\nexternal-modules-download-path: .external_modules\nframework:\n  - versions of Python. This means we currently support Python 3.7 - 3.11, inclusive. Note that Python 3.7 is reaching EOL on June 2023. After that time, we will have a short grace period where we will continue 3.7 support until September 2023, and then it will no longer be considered supported for Checkov. If you run into any issues with any non-EOL Python version, please open an alt="slack-community" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/badge/Slack-4A154B?style=plastic&logo=slack&logoColor=white" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto"><strong>Checkov</strong> is a static code analysis tool for infrastructure as code (IaC) and also a software composition analysis (SCA) tool for images and open source packages.</p><p dir="auto">It scans cloud infrastructure provisioned using <a href="https://terraform.io/" rel="nofollow">Terraform</a>, <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Terraform%20Plan%20Scanning.md">Terraform plan</a>, <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Cloudformation.md">Cloudformation</a>, <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/AWS%20SAM.md">AWS SAM</a>, <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Kubernetes.md">Kubernetes</a>, <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Helm.md">Helm charts</a>, <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Kustomize.md">Kustomize</a>, <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Dockerfile.md">Dockerfile</a>,  <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Serverless%20Framework.md">Serverless</a>, <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Bicep.md">Bicep</a>, <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/OpenAPI.md">OpenAPI</a> or <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Azure%20ARM%20templates.md">ARM Templates</a> and detects security and compliance misconfigurations using graph-based scanning.</p><p dir="auto">It performs <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/7.Scan%20Examples/Sca.md">Software Composition Analysis (SCA) scanning</a> which is a scan of open source packages and images for Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs).</p><p dir="auto">Checkov also powers <a href="https://www.prismacloud.io/prisma/cloud/cloud-code-security/?utm_source=github&utm_medium=organic_oss&utm_campaign=checkov" rel="nofollow"><strong>Prisma Cloud Application Security</strong></a>, the developer-first platform that codifies and streamlines cloud security throughout the development lifecycle. Prisma Cloud identifies, fixes, and prevents misconfigurations in cloud resources and infrastructure-as-code files.</p><a href="https://www.prismacloud.io/prisma/request-a-prisma-cloud-trial/?utm_campaign=checkov-github-repo&utm_source=github.com&utm_medium=get-started-button" title="Try_Prisma_Cloud" rel="nofollow"> 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><ul dir="auto"><li><a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/5.Policy%20Index/all.md">Over 1000 built-in policies</a> cover security and compliance best practices for AWS, Azure and Google Cloud.</li><li>Scans Terraform, Terraform Plan, Terraform JSON, CloudFormation, AWS SAM, Kubernetes, Helm, Kustomize, Dockerfile, Serverless framework, Ansible, Bicep and ARM template files.</li><li>Scans Argo Workflows, Azure Pipelines, BitBucket Pipelines, Circle CI Pipelines, GitHub Actions and GitLab CI workflow files</li><li>Supports Context-awareness policies based on in-memory graph-based scanning.</li><li>Supports Python format for attribute policies and YAML format for both attribute and composite policies.</li><li>Detects <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/2.Basics/Scanning%20Credentials%20and%20Secrets.md">AWS credentials</a> in EC2 Userdata, Lambda environment variables and Terraform providers.</li><li><a href="https://www.prismacloud.io/prisma/cloud/secrets-security" rel="nofollow">Identifies secrets</a> using regular expressions, keywords, and entropy based detection.</li><li>Evaluates <a href="https://registry.terraform.io/browse/providers" rel="nofollow">Terraform Provider</a> settings to regulate the creation, management, and updates of IaaS, PaaS or SaaS managed through Terraform.</li><li>Policies support evaluation of <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/2.Basics/Handling%20Variables.md">variables</a> to their optional default value.</li><li>Supports in-line <a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/2.Basics/Suppressing%20and%20Skipping%20Policies.md">suppression</a> of accepted risks or false-positives to reduce recurring scan failures. Also supports global skip from using CLI.</li><li><a href="/bridgecrewio/checkov/blob/main/docs/2.Basics/Reviewing%20Scan%20Results.md">Output</a> currently available as CLI, <a href="https://cyclonedx.org" rel="nofollow">CycloneDX</a>, JSON, JUnit XML, CSV, SARIF and github markdown and link to remediation <a href="https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/enterprise-edition/policy-reference/" rel="nofollow">guides</a>.</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Using Docker</h3><a id="user-content-using-docker" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Using Docker" href="#using-docker"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="docker pull bridgecrew/checkovdocker run --tty --rm --volume /user/tf:/tf --workdir /tf bridgecrew/checkov --directory /tf"><pre>docker pull bridgecrew/checkovdocker run --tty --rm --volume /user/tf:/tf --workdir /tf bridgecrew/checkov --directory /tf</pre></div><p dir="auto">Note: if you are using Python 3.6(Default version in Ubuntu 18.04) checkov will not work, and it will fail with <code>ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'dataclasses'</code>  error message. In this case, you can use the docker version instead.</p><p dir="auto">Note that there are certain cases where redirecting <code>docker run --tty</code> output to a file - for example, if you want to save the Checkov JUnit output to a file - will cause extra control characters to be printed. This can break file parsing. If you encounter this, remove the <code>--tty</code> flag.</p><p dir="auto">The <code>--workdir /tf</code> flag is optional to change the working directory to the mounted volume. If you are using the SARIF output <code>-o sarif</code> this will output the results.sarif file to the mounted volume (<code>/user/tf</code> in the example above). If you do not include that flag, the working directory will be "/".</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Running or skipping checks</h3><a id="user-content-running-or-skipping-checks" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Running or skipping checks" href="#running-or-skipping-checks"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By using command line flags, you can specify to run only named checks (allow list) or run all checks exceptthose listed (deny list). If you are using the platform integration via API key, you can also specify a severity threshold to skip and / or include.Moreover, as json files can't contain comments, one can pass regex pattern to skip json file secret scan.</p><p dir="auto">See the docs for more detailed information about how these flags work together.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Examples</h2><a id="user-content-examples" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Examples" href="#examples"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Allow only the two specified checks to run:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov --directory . --check CKV_AWS_20,CKV_AWS_57"><pre>checkov --directory <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --check CKV_AWS_20,CKV_AWS_57</pre></div><p dir="auto">Run all checks except the one specified:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --skip-check CKV_AWS_20"><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --skip-check CKV_AWS_20</pre></div><p dir="auto">Run all checks except checks with specified patterns:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --skip-check CKV_AWS*"><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --skip-check CKV_AWS<span class="pl-k">*</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Run all checks that are MEDIUM severity or higher (requires API key):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --check MEDIUM --bc-api-key ..."><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --check MEDIUM --bc-api-key ...</pre></div><p dir="auto">Run all checks that are MEDIUM severity or higher, as well as check CKV_123 (assume this is a LOW severity check):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --check MEDIUM,CKV_123 --bc-api-key ..."><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --check MEDIUM,CKV_123 --bc-api-key ...</pre></div><p dir="auto">Skip all checks that are MEDIUM severity or lower:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --skip-check MEDIUM --bc-api-key ..."><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --skip-check MEDIUM --bc-api-key ...</pre></div><p dir="auto">Skip all checks that are MEDIUM severity or lower, as well as check CKV_789 (assume this is a high severity check):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --skip-check MEDIUM,CKV_789 --bc-api-key ..."><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --skip-check MEDIUM,CKV_789 --bc-api-key ...</pre></div><p dir="auto">Run all checks that are MEDIUM severity or higher, but skip check CKV_123 (assume this is a medium or higher severity check):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --check MEDIUM --skip-check CKV_123 --bc-api-key ..."><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --check MEDIUM --skip-check CKV_123 --bc-api-key ...</pre></div><p dir="auto">Run check CKV_789, but skip it if it is a medium severity (the --check logic is always applied before --skip-check)</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --skip-check MEDIUM --check CKV_789 --bc-api-key ..."><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --skip-check MEDIUM --check CKV_789 --bc-api-key ...</pre></div><p dir="auto">For Kubernetes workloads, you can also use allow/deny namespaces.  For example, do not report any results for thekube-system namespace:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --skip-check kube-system"><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --skip-check kube-system</pre></div><p dir="auto">Run a scan of a container image. First pull or build the image then refer to it by the hash, ID, or name:tag:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov --framework sca_image --docker-image sha256:1234example --dockerfile-path /Users/path/to/Dockerfile --bc-api-key ...checkov --docker-image <image-name>:tag --dockerfile-path /User/path/to/Dockerfile --bc-api-key ..."><pre>checkov --framework sca_image --docker-image sha256:1234example --dockerfile-path /Users/path/to/Dockerfile --bc-api-key ...checkov --docker-image <span class="pl-k"><</span>image-name<span class="pl-k">></span>:tag --dockerfile-path /User/path/to/Dockerfile --bc-api-key ...</pre></div><p dir="auto">You can use --image flag also to scan container image instead of --docker-image for shortener:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov --image <image-name>:tag --dockerfile-path /User/path/to/Dockerfile --bc-api-key ..."><pre>checkov --image <span class="pl-k"><</span>image-name<span class="pl-k">></span>:tag --dockerfile-path /User/path/to/Dockerfile --bc-api-key ...</pre></div><p dir="auto">Run an SCA scan of packages in a repo:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d . --framework sca_package --bc-api-key ... --repo-id <repo_id(arbitrary)>"><pre>checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span> --framework sca_package --bc-api-key ... --repo-id <span class="pl-k"><</span>repo_id(arbitrary)<span class="pl-k">></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Run a scan of a directory with environment variables removing buffering, adding debug level logs:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG checkov -d ."><pre>PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG checkov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">OR enable the environment variables for multiple runs</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 LOG_LEVEL=DEBUGcheckov -d ."><pre><span class="pl-k">export</span> PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 LOG_LEVEL=DEBUGcheckov -d <span class="pl-c1">.</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Run secrets scanning on all files in MyDirectory. Skip CKV_SECRET_6 check on json files that their suffix is DontScan</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d /MyDirectory --framework secrets --bc-api-key ... --skip-check CKV_SECRET_6:.*DontScan.json$"><pre>checkov -d /MyDirectory --framework secrets --bc-api-key ... --skip-check CKV_SECRET_6:.<span class="pl-k">*</span>DontScan.json$</pre></div><p dir="auto">Run secrets scanning on all files in MyDirectory. Skip CKV_SECRET_6 check on json files that contains "skip_test" in path</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov -d /MyDirectory --framework secrets --bc-api-key ... --skip-check CKV_SECRET_6:.*skip_test.*json$"><pre>checkov -d /MyDirectory --framework secrets --bc-api-key ... --skip-check CKV_SECRET_6:.<span class="pl-k">*</span>skip_test.<span class="pl-k">*</span>json$</pre></div><p dir="auto">One can mask values from scanning results by supplying a configuration file (using --config-file flag) with mask entry.The masking can apply on resource & value (or multiple values, seperated with a comma).Examples:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="mask:- aws_instance:user_data- azurerm_key_vault_secret:admin_password,user_passwords"><pre>mask:- aws_instance:user_data- azurerm_key_vault_secret:admin_password,user_passwords</pre></div><p dir="auto">In the example above, the following values will be masked:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>user_data for aws_instance resource</li><li>both admin_password &user_passwords for azurerm_key_vault_secret</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Suppressing/Ignoring a check</h3><a id="user-content-suppressingignoring-a-check" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Suppressing/Ignoring a check" href="#suppressingignoring-a-check"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Like any static-analysis tool it is limited by its analysis scope.For example, if a resource is managed manually, or using subsequent configuration management tooling,suppression can be inserted as a simple code annotation.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Suppression comment format</h4><a id="user-content-suppression-comment-format" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Suppression comment format" href="#suppression-comment-format"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">To skip a check on a given Terraform definition block or CloudFormation resource, apply the following comment pattern inside it's scope:</p><p dir="auto"><code>checkov:skip=<check_id>:<suppression_comment></code></p><ul dir="auto"><li><code><check_id></code> is one of the [available check scanners](docs/5.Policy Index/all.md)</li><li><code><suppression_comment></code> is an optional suppression reason to be included in the output</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Example</h4><a id="user-content-example" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Example" href="#example"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The following comment skips the <code>CKV_AWS_20</code> check on the resource identified by <code>foo-bucket</code>, where the scan checks if an AWS S3 bucket is private.In the example, the bucket is configured with public read access; Adding the suppress comment would skip the appropriate check instead of the check to fail.</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="resource "aws_s3_bucket" "foo-bucket" {  region        = var.region    #checkov:skip=CKV_AWS_20:The bucket is a public static content host  bucket        = local.bucket_name  force_destroy = true  acl           = "public-read"}"><pre lang="hcl-terraform" class="notranslate"><code>resource "aws_s3_bucket" "foo-bucket" {  region        = var.region    #checkov:skip=CKV_AWS_20:The bucket is a public static content host  bucket        = local.bucket_name  force_destroy = true  acl           = "public-read"}</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">The output would now contain a <code>SKIPPED</code> check result entry:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="......Check: "S3 Bucket has an ACL defined which allows public access."SKIPPED for resource: aws_s3_bucket.foo-bucketSuppress comment: The bucket is a public static content hostFile: /example_skip_acl.tf:1-25..."><pre>......Check: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>S3 Bucket has an ACL defined which allows public access.<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>SKIPPED <span class="pl-k">for</span> resource: aws_s3_bucket.foo-bucketSuppress comment: The bucket is a public static content hostFile: /example_skip_acl.tf:1-25...</pre></div><p dir="auto">To skip multiple checks, add each as a new line.</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="  #checkov:skip=CKV2_AWS_6  #checkov:skip=CKV_AWS_20:The bucket is a public static content host"><pre class="notranslate"><code>  #checkov:skip=CKV2_AWS_6  #checkov:skip=CKV_AWS_20:The bucket is a public static content host</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">To suppress checks in Kubernetes manifests, annotations are used with the following format:<code>checkov.io/skip#: <check_id>=<suppression_comment></code></p><p dir="auto">For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="apiVersion: v1kind: Podmetadata:  name: mypod  annotations:    checkov.io/skip1: CKV_K8S_20=I don't care about Privilege Escalation :-O    checkov.io/skip2: CKV_K8S_14    checkov.io/skip3: CKV_K8S_11=I have not set CPU limits as I want BestEffort QoSspec:  containers:..."><pre>apiVersion: v1kind: Podmetadata:  name: mypod  annotations:    checkov.io/skip1: CKV_K8S_20=I don<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>t care about Privilege Escalation :-O</span><span class="pl-s">    checkov.io/skip2: CKV_K8S_14</span><span class="pl-s">    checkov.io/skip3: CKV_K8S_11=I have not set CPU limits as I want BestEffort QoS</span><span class="pl-s">spec:</span><span class="pl-s">  containers:</span><span class="pl-s">...</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Logging</h4><a id="user-content-logging" class="anchor-element" <code>LOG_LEVEL</code> to <code>DEBUG</code>.</p><p dir="auto">Default is <code>LOG_LEVEL=WARNING</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Skipping directories</h4><a id="user-content-skipping-directories" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Skipping directories" href="#skipping-directories"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">To skip files or directories, use the argument <code>--skip-path</code>, which can be specified multiple times. This argument accepts regular expressions for paths relative to the current working directory. You can use it to skip entire directories and / or specific files.</p><p dir="auto">By default, all directories named <code>node_modules</code>, <code>.terraform</code>, and <code>.serverless</code> will be skipped, in addition to any files or directories beginning with <code>.</code>.To cancel skipping directories beginning with <code>.</code> override <code>CKV_IGNORE_HIDDEN_DIRECTORIES</code> environment variable <code>export CKV_IGNORE_HIDDEN_DIRECTORIES=false</code></p><p dir="auto">You can override the default set of directories to skip by setting the environment variable <code>CKV_IGNORED_DIRECTORIES</code>.Note that if you want to preserve this list and add to it, you must include these values. For example, <code>CKV_IGNORED_DIRECTORIES=mynewdir</code> will skip only that directory, but not the others mentioned above. This variable is legacy functionality; we recommend using the <code>--skip-file</code> flag.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Console Output</h4><a id="user-content-console-output" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Console Output" href="#console-output"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Configuration using a config file</h3><a id="user-content-configuration-using-a-config-file" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Configuration using a config file" href="#configuration-using-a-config-file"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Checkov can be configured using a YAML configuration file. By default, checkov looks for a <code>.checkov.yaml</code> or <code>.checkov.yml</code> file in the following places in order of precedence:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>Directory against which checkov is run. (<code>--directory</code>)</li><li>Current working directory where checkov is called.</li><li>User's home directory.</li></ul><p dir="auto"><strong>Attention</strong>: it is a best practice for checkov configuration file to be loaded from a trusted source composed by a verified identity, so that scanned files, check ids and loaded custom checks are as desired.</p><p dir="auto">Users can also pass in the path to a config file via the command line. In this case, the other config files will be ignored. For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov --config-file path/to/config.yaml"><pre>checkov --config-file path/to/config.yaml</pre></div><p dir="auto">Users can also create a config file using the <code>--create-config</code> command, which takes the current command line args and writes them out to a given path. For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov --compact --directory test-dir --docker-image sample-image --dockerfile-path Dockerfile --download-external-modules True --external-checks-dir sample-dir --quiet --repo-id prisma-cloud/sample-repo --skip-check CKV_DOCKER_3,CKV_DOCKER_2 --skip-framework dockerfile secrets --soft-fail --branch develop --check CKV_DOCKER_1 --create-config /Users/sample/config.yml"><pre>checkov --compact --directory test-dir --docker-image sample-image --dockerfile-path Dockerfile --download-external-modules True --external-checks-dir sample-dir --quiet --repo-id prisma-cloud/sample-repo --skip-check CKV_DOCKER_3,CKV_DOCKER_2 --skip-framework dockerfile secrets --soft-fail --branch develop --check CKV_DOCKER_1 --create-config /Users/sample/config.yml</pre></div><p dir="auto">Will create a <code>config.yaml</code> file which looks like this:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-yaml notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="branch: developcheck:  - CKV_DOCKER_1compact: truedirectory:  - test-dirdocker-image: sample-imagedockerfile-path: Dockerfiledownload-external-modules: trueevaluate-variables: trueexternal-checks-dir:  - sample-direxternal-modules-download-path: .external_modulesframework:  - all output: cli quiet: true repo-id: prisma-cloud/sample-repo skip-check:   - CKV_DOCKER_3   - CKV_DOCKER_2 skip-framework:  - dockerfile  - secretssoft-fail: true"><pre><span class="pl-ent">branch</span>: <span class="pl-s">develop</span><span class="pl-ent">check</span>:  - <span class="pl-s">CKV_DOCKER_1</span><span class="pl-ent">compact</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-ent">directory</span>:  - <span class="pl-s">test-dir</span><span class="pl-ent">docker-image</span>: <span class="pl-s">sample-image</span><span class="pl-ent">dockerfile-path</span>: <span class="pl-s">Dockerfile</span><span class="pl-ent">download-external-modules</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-ent">evaluate-variables</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-ent">external-checks-dir</span>:  - <span class="pl-s">sample-dir</span><span class="pl-ent">external-modules-download-path</span>: <span class="pl-s">.external_modules</span><span class="pl-ent">framework</span>:  - <span class="pl-s">all </span><span class="pl-ent">output</span>: <span class="pl-s">cli </span><span class="pl-ent">quiet</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span> <span class="pl-ent">repo-id</span>: <span class="pl-s">prisma-cloud/sample-repo </span><span class="pl-ent">skip-check</span>:   - <span class="pl-s">CKV_DOCKER_3 </span>  - <span class="pl-s">CKV_DOCKER_2 </span><span class="pl-ent">skip-framework</span>:  - <span class="pl-s">dockerfile</span>  - <span class="pl-s">secrets</span><span class="pl-ent">soft-fail</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Users can also use the <code>--show-config</code> flag to view all the args and settings and where they came from i.e. commandline, config file, environment variable or default. For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="checkov --show-config"><pre>checkov --show-config</pre></div><p dir="auto">Will display:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" branch:            master  skip-check:        ['CKV_DOCKER_3', 'CKV_DOCKER_2']Defaults:  --output:          cli  --framework:       ['all']  --download-external-modules:False  --external-modules-download-path:.external_modules  --evaluate-variables:True"><pre>Command Line Args:   --show-configEnvironment Variables:  BC_API_KEY:        your-api-keyConfig File
